# Frequently asked questions

## How do I get help?

Great question!!

MIRA is under active development. If you need help, would like to contribute, or simply want to talk about the project with like-minded individuals, we have a number of open channels for communication.

- To report bugs or file feature requests, use the [issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/nbx0/MIRA/issues).

- To contribute code submit a [pull request on Github](https://github.com/nbx0/MIRA/pulls).


## How to upgrate or remove older versions of MIRA or other containers?

To upgrade MIRA, spyne, IRMA or DAIS-Ribosome, you first need to remove your current version from your machine.

Usually you will only need to update some of the 4 required containers.

Follow the removal instructions based on your version, either the original [IRMA-SPY](#irma-spy-uninstall) or [MIRA](#mira-uninstall).

### MIRA uninstall

1. Open an Ubuntu terminal
2. ```bash 
    # Show running containers
    docker ps
    
    # Stop running container you want to update. In this example we are updating mira and spyne.
    docker stop mira spyne

    # Delete containers
    docker rm mira spyne

    # Delete images
    docker rmi mira spyne
    ```
3. Install the new MIRA and spyne containers: [See NGS Training: Setting Up Containers](setting-up-containers.html)

### IRMA-SPY uninstall

1. Open an Ubuntu terminal
2. ```bash 
    # Show running containers
    docker ps
    
    # Stop running container you want to update. In this example we are updating mira and spyne.
    docker stop irma-spy sc2-spike-seq

    # Delete containers
    docker rm irma-spy sc2-spike-seq

    # Delete images
    docker rmi irma-spy sc2-spike-seq
    ```
3. Install the new MIRA and spyne containers: [See NGS Training: Setting Up Containers](setting-up-containers.html)
